revised_title: Fossil Flora of North Greenland: Edward Whymper's 1867 Expedition
tldr: This article describes the fossil plant discoveries made during Edward Whymper's 1867 expedition to North Greenland. The findings, which include 73 species, confirm the age of the deposits as Lower Miocene and provide insight into the climate and vegetation of the region during that time. The collected specimens were deposited in the British Museum.
